p: We provide correlation coefficients r( θ, τ) ∈ (−1, 1) between our summary statistics τ ∈ { FI ∞, R 0} and SPV characteristics θ ∈ { m, β, CV( SPV), σ( SPV), Sk( SPV)} in Table 2. The parameter β provides the best predictor for both R 0 and FI ∞. On the other hand, the heterogeneity described by CV( SPV), and the skewness of the susceptibility distribution described through Sk( SPV), also emerge as good predictors of FI ∞.
